Subjective: Left ear discomfort, feels water-filled; Left ear pain, worse after showering; Duration 2-3 days, gradually worsening; Hearing impaired Left ear; Pain 0-4 daily, 6-7 after showering; Unable to swim due to pain; No fever, no general illness, body feels normal; No painkillers taken; Social: Swims frequently (new sport), cleans ears with cotton buds 3x/week; Request: Wants ear examined, wants pain to stop, worried about ear.
Objective: Temp: 36.2 C; Right ear: Clean, eardrum fine; Left ear: Pain on pulling pinna; Ear canal red, inflamed, swollen, thick; Eardrum not well visualized.
Assessment: Left Otitis externa, susp. water exposure/cotton bud use. No systemic illness.
Plan: Explanation: Left ear canal inflamed, likely from water exposure & cotton bud use.
- Paracetamol: Up to 4000 mg/day PRN for pain.
- Ear drops: Anti-inflammatory, acidic. 3x/day for 1 week.
- Keep Left ear dry for 1 week.
